intro: Cynoglossum amplifolium f. macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited heartworts, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its fruits are distinctive, being large and capsule-like, containing numerous small seeds. This variety is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
